result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing held by Zoom video due to the Covid19 pandemic.
11:02 am   Defendant Montgomery A Jacobs appeared by video means with Attorney Thomas Locante by video.  Attorney Gideon Wertheimer appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Court:  I know Montgomery.  I presided over his adoption years ago.  I've known the adoptive parents for many years.  If that creates an issue for anyone, I'll step aside.  I'll take the position that it wouldn't affect my judgment....  Locante:  We touched upon the issue of a Judge, but not so much in that context.  He did advise that he was in your court once before and was okay with that.
Prelim waiver gone over with Def.. No threats/promises.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered

11:30 am   Case recalled.  Same appearances.
Locante:  We're not asking for a recusal at this point.
Court will find there's been disclosure and waiver of recusal.
